awd_titl_txt: Antiinsectan Natural Products from Fungal Sclerotia
awd_abstract_narration: The Synthetic Organic Chemistry program supports the work of                    Dr. James Gloer.  Gloer, an assistant professor of chemistry at                 the University of Iowa, is looking for novel and biologically                   active compounds from fungi.  Gloer has identified a new source                 of natural products in fungal sclerotia, physiological                          structures associated with fungi that have been overlooked by                   other natural products chemists.                                                                                                                                Sclerotial extracts from plant pathogenic and stored-product                    fungi will be tested for insect antifeedant activity.  Active                   samples will be chromatographed to find the active components                   of the extracts.  Structure analysis will be performed on the                   new compounds isolated.  Examination of the source of these new                 metabolites will focus on the particular fungal physiological                   structure that produces the compounds in order to generate                      fundamental new knowledge on the origins and biosignificance of                 these compounds in Nature.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
